instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Keyboard keys (QWERTYUIO) not working. Common problem ? Macbook Air 2003 A1466
threads.message:
The keys (qwertyuio) of my Macbook air 2003 A1466 suddenly stopped working.

I found several questions online about that and did not find any threads about that issue here:

Here is a list of other threads about the issue.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/219990/macbook-air-2011-mid-keyboard-keys-q-w-e-r-t-y-u-i-o-working-sporadically[/URL]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://discussions.apple.com/thread/7682437[/URL]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://forums.macrumors.com/threads/macbook-qwertyuio-keys-not-working.262914/[/URL]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.fixya.com/support/t23789779-keyboard_keys_q_w_e_r_t_y_u_o_not[/URL]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.ifixit.com/Answers/View/252514/Keyboard+Intermittently+Non+Responsive+-+Top+row+of+Qwerty+only[/URL]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.justanswer.com/computer/e9bxm-macbook-pro-13-inch-mid-2012-qwertyuio-keys.html[/URL]

None of which have any meaningful answers.
It seems is it not caused by dust, etc because it is always the same keys.
Looks more to me like design defect or common problem that develops with time.

Have any of you encountered such issue and do you have some suggestions what can I try or look for ?

Best regards,
Alex

threads.title: Keyboard keys (QWERTYUIO) not working. Common problem ? Macbook Air 2003 A1466
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

I suppose you wanted to say 2013.
Is that 820-3437 board?

For Air machines, keyboard matrix is coded into trackpad board.
So partially non-working keys can't be a MLB problem.
